physical_appearance:\The image depicts a wedding gown. It is totally white in colour. It is also long-sleeved and there are laces running in a criss-cross pattern at the lower portion of the sleeve towards the hands.There is a collar which is made in the form of the scalloping pattern. The sleeve cuffs are also constructed in similar fashion. The label tag is still intact at the back collar of the gown. The tag states
 \\Harrods\\. There are no visible tears and stains on the exterior of the wedding gown. The sleeves are transparent but not the rest of the gown. \

 Ltd
sgcool_label_text:This is a wedding gown designed by Singapore-born Benny Ong. Ong was well-known for his designer cocktail and evening wear from the 1970s to 1990s. The early collections of Ong were sold at Harrods and Selfridges
 two of London’s most reputable departmental stores. Ong is one of the pioneer Singapore-born designers known for dressing royalty such as the late Princess Diana and for establishing his brand in London. This dress was bought from Harrods in 1977 and wore by the donor
 Claire Buske for her wedding in Canada in the same year.

metadata.physical_appearance: "The image depicts a wedding gown. It is totally white in colour. It is also long-sleeved and there are laces running in a criss-cross pattern at the lower portion of the sleeve towards the hands.There is a collar which is made in the form of the scalloping pattern. The sleeve cuffs are also constructed in similar fashion. The label tag is still intact at the back collar of the gown. The tag states, ""Harrods"". There are no visible tears and stains on the exterior of the wedding gown. The sleeves are transparent but not the rest of the gown. "

metadata.sgcool_label_text: This is a wedding gown designed by Singapore-born Benny Ong. Ong was well-known for his designer cocktail and evening wear from the 1970s to 1990s. The early collections of Ong were sold at Harrods and Selfridges, two of London’s most reputable departmental stores. Ong is one of the pioneer Singapore-born designers known for dressing royalty such as the late Princess Diana and for establishing his brand in London. This dress was bought from Harrods in 1977 and wore by the donor, Claire Buske for her wedding in Canada in the same year.
